intro: Gaudichaudia mcvaughii, commonly known as the Hawaiian gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. It is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
